Node Reference — ALWAYS USE EXACT NAMES AND CASE

NodeType: IN — Always the first node
  IN: Execute — Executes once when the game starts or the actor is spawned
    OUT: Then — Executes the next node

NodeType: Branch — If/else conditional branch
  IN: Execute — Runs the branch rule
  OUT: True — If the condition passes, executes the next node
  OUT: False — If the condition fails, executes the next node
    RULE: Condition — A Boolean expression, e.g. bIsOpen == true

NodeType: CAST — Attempts to cast an object to a different class
  IN: Execute — Executes the cast rule
  OUT: CastSucceeded — If the cast succeeded, executes the next node
  OUT: CastFailed — If the cast failed, executes the next node
    RULE: Object — The object to cast
    RULE: Class — The class to attempt casting to

NodeType: PRINT — Prints a string to the screen
  IN: Execute — Fires once, prints the formatted string
    RULE: Format — A string format rule, e.g. "Your score is: {Score}"

Node: Pins — ALWAYS lowercase
Event: Enter — exec OUT

Node Types:
Event — Fires once when the game starts or the actor receives an event
Action — Executes a single function with no return value
Branch — If/else conditional branch
BoolData — Stores a Boolean data value
FloatData — Stores a floating-point data value
Gate — Passes or blocks execution flow
FlipFlop — Alternates between two execution paths
ForEachLoop — Iterates over each element in an array
DoOnce — Executes only the first time, blocks subsequent calls
Delay — Pauses execution flow for a specified duration
DestroyActor — Deletes the owning actor
PrintText — Displays text on the screen
SetVisibility — Sets visibility of target actor(s)
AddFloat — Adds two float values
SubtractFloat — Subtracts B from A
MultiplyFloat — Multiplies two float values
GreaterThan — Returns true if A > B

Node Pins:
Exec IN: Execute — Executes the node
Data IN: Bool, Float — Accepts data of any type
Exec OUT: Then — Executes the next node
Data OUT: Bool, Float — Outputs data of any type
Branch OUT: True, False — Execution paths based on a true/false condition
LoopBody OUT — Executes multiple times, once for each element in an array
LoopIteration OUT — Executes zero or more times, once before each loop iteration
LoopArrayIndex OUT — Outputs the current index of a looping array, starting at 0
FlipFlop OUT: A, B — Alternate execution paths
Delay OUT: Completed — Executes after a specified duration

Node Types:
